duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect patient specimens for testing in a timely manner, including routine and advanced venipuncture.
Ensure positive patient identification prior to specimen collection and adherence to strict medical protocol.
Process emergency orders within the required time frame and label each specimen accurately.
Operate departmental computer programs to activate orders, perform order management, and troubleshoot as necessary.
Maintain stock of commonly used supplies, perform routine inspections of stock levels, and review expiration dates.
Perform preventive maintenance on equipment and take prompt action to resolve any problems with specimen collection and processing.
Document issues, problems, and opportunities, and escalate to supervisory staff when appropriate.
Participate in quality improvement activities and attend educational in-services and training classes.
May review test requisitions, order tests appropriately, and provide patients with instruction regarding non-blood specimen collections.
Perform basic clerical duties as needed and assist in training new staff or students in blood collection and/or specimen processing.
May assume coordinator responsibilities in the absence of supervisory staff.
Maintain and utilize computerized carts, adhere to patient isolation procedures, and maintain phone availability for emergent collections.
Interact with clinical staff to maintain computerized records, resolve, and troubleshoot outstanding specimen/collections.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent (Phlebotomy certificate preferred)
